channel.title: Science Friday
channel.description: Covering everything about science and technology -- from the outer reaches of space to the tiniest microbes in our bodies -- Science Friday is your source for entertaining and educational stories and activities. Each week, host Ira Flatow interviews scientists and inventors like Sylvia Earle, Elon Musk, Neil deGrasse Tyson, and more.
channel.itunes:subtitle: It's brain fun, for curious people
channel.itunes:author: Science Friday
channel.itunes:summary: Covering everything about science and technology -- from the outer reaches of space to the tiniest microbes in our bodies -- Science Friday is your source for entertaining and educational stories and activities. Each week, host Ira Flatow interviews scientists and inventors like Sylvia Earle, Elon Musk, Neil deGrasse Tyson, and more.

item.title: Hr1: News Roundup, Climate and the Collapse of Ancient Civilizations, Climate Fiction
item.dc:creator: Science Friday
item.description: Writer Paolo Bacigalupi is using fiction to help us imagine our climate change futureÂ—and he is not alone. Plus, how did climate change affect the boom-and-bust cycles of of ancient Southwest civilizations in the United States?
item.itunes:subtitle: Writer Paolo Bacigalupi is using fiction to help us imagine our climate change futureÂ—and he is not alone. Plus, how did climate change affect the boom-and-bust cycles of of ancient Southwest civilizations in the United States?

item.title: Hr2: Insulin Pricing, Science From Space, Lab Girl Memoir
item.dc:creator: Science Friday
item.description: Undiscovered tombs and pyramids can be found right on your iPad, if you know what to look for. Plus, the memoir _Lab Girl_ from geobiologist Hope Jahren.
item.itunes:subtitle: Undiscovered tombs and pyramids can be found right on your iPad, if you know what to look for. Plus, the memoir _Lab Girl_ from geobiologist Hope Jahren.

item.title: Hr1: News Roundup, How Games Move Us, Spot the Spoof Science Study
item.dc:creator: Science Friday
item.description: Some of todays video games are pushing players into new emotional territory, engaging complex feelings like complicity, empathy, and grief. Plus, how good are you at picking out an authentic research study from a spoof?
item.itunes:subtitle: Some of todays video games are pushing players into new emotional territory, engaging complex feelings like complicity, empathy, and grief. Plus, how good are you at picking out an authentic research study from a spoof?

item.title: Hr2: Sea Level Rise, Sorting Out Social Media Feeds, Springtime Blooms
item.dc:creator: Science Friday
item.description: A new study suggests a melting Antarctica could pump up global sea levels much more than previously predicted. Plus, social media feed curation, and how springtime can bring some unexpected blooms.
item.itunes:subtitle: A new study suggests a melting Antarctica could pump up global sea levels much more than previously predicted. Plus, social media feed curation, and how springtime can bring some unexpected blooms.
item.content:encoded: A new study suggests a melting Antarctica could pump up global sea levels much more than previously predicted. Plus, social media feed curation, and how springtime can bring some unexpected blooms.

item.itunes:author: Science Friday

item.title: Hr2: Ancient Beer, Unlocking the Encryption Debate
item.dc:creator: Science Friday
item.description: In the 90s, the Clipper Chip was the big government encryption case. Two Science Friday guests involved in that early debate rejoin us to weigh in on the Apple argument. Plus, two anthropologists are studying an ancient brewery.
item.itunes:subtitle: In the 90s, the Clipper Chip was the big government encryption case. Two Science Friday guests involved in that early debate rejoin us to weigh in on the Apple argument. Plus, two anthropologists are studying an ancient brewery.

item.itunes:author: Science Friday

item.title: Hr1: News Roundup, Minimalist Biology, The Road to LIGO
item.dc:creator: Science Friday
item.description: Craig Venter and his team have booted up a cell with only the bare minimum genetic instructions required for life. Plus, Janna Levin on LIGO.
item.itunes:subtitle: Craig Venter and his team have booted up a cell with only the bare minimum genetic instructions required for life. Plus, Janna Levin on LIGO.
item.content:encoded: Craig Venter and his team have booted up a cell with only the bare minimum genetic instructions required for life. Plus, Janna Levin on LIGO.

item.itunes:author: Science Friday

item.title: Hr2: Tricking Tumor Cells, Investigating Sea Level Rise on a Local Level, Teaching Climate Change Science
item.dc:creator: Science Friday
item.description: A panel of education experts discusses challenges and approaches to teaching climate change science in the classroom. Plus, how a new method convinces cancer cells to gobble up a ball of poison and ferry it directly to the cell nucleus.
item.itunes:subtitle: A panel of education experts discusses challenges and approaches to teaching climate change science in the classroom. Plus, how a new method convinces cancer cells to gobble up a ball of poison and ferry it directly to the cell nucleus.

item.title: Hr1: News Roundup, Serengeti Rules, A Space Program
item.dc:creator: Science Friday
item.description: Sculptor Tom Sachs has built his own space program, and it is 100 percent DIY. Plus, biologist Sean B. Carroll describes some of the greatest experiments in ecology.
item.itunes:subtitle: Sculptor Tom Sachs has built his own space program, and it is 100 percent DIY. Plus, biologist Sean B. Carroll describes some of the greatest experiments in ecology.

item.title: Hr2: Ocular Stem Cell Therapy, Ask an Ophthalmologist, Quantum Computing, Pi
item.dc:creator: Science Friday
item.description: Ophthalmologists Lisa Park and Anne Sumers address queries about eyes and vision. Plus, Researchers used stem cells to grow eye tissues. And a look at the potential of quantum computers.
item.itunes:subtitle: Ophthalmologists Lisa Park and Anne Sumers address queries about eyes and vision. Plus, Researchers used stem cells to grow eye tissues. And a look at the potential of quantum computers.

item.title: Hr1: News Roundup, Processed Cheese, Cheese Bacteria
item.dc:creator: Science Friday
item.description: We dive into the world of cheese, from the microbes that help make it, to the chemistry that gives processed cheese its properties. Plus, some of the week's science stories.
item.itunes:subtitle: We dive into the world of cheese, from the microbes that help make it, to the chemistry that gives processed cheese its properties. Plus, some of the weeks science stories.
